body:
Thanks @arunagw

I think this issue is existed on master yet.
My reproduce step:

```
$ ruby -v
ruby 1.9.3p125 (2012-02-16 revision 34643) [x86_64-linux]
$ rails -v
Rails 3.2.2

$ rails new app --edge
$ cd app

$ vim Gemfile
(replace 3-2-stable to master)
$ bundle update

$ bundle exec rails g scaffold Post title
$ RAILS_ENV=production RAILS_GROUPS=assets bundle exec rake assets:precompile

$ ls -la tmp/cache/
drwxrwxr-x  4 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:29 .
drwxrwxr-x  3 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:27 ..
drwxrwxr-x 20 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:29 assets
drwxrwxr-x  3 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:29 sass

# no problem.

$ bundle exec rake assets:clean

$ ls -la tmp/cache/assets/
drwxrwxr-x 2 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:19 .
drwxrwxr-x 4 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:17 ..

# no problem.

$ ls -la tmp/cache/sass/
drwxrwxr-x 3 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:17 .
drwxrwxr-x 4 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:17 ..
drwxrwxr-x 2 kennyj kennyj 4096  3月 28 01:17 901b94708b2b9d113c4b73f8db8b471ec301c326

★ I guess we have a problem, because I expect sass directory is empty.
```

Before we merged #4427, the *assets:cache:clean* task just removed tmp/cache/* by executing the *tmp:cache:clear* task.

p.s. sorry, I have a lot of work at least this week ;-)
